column1: This morning the first all-female spacewalk occurred. Congratulations to NASA astronauts Christina Koch and Jessica Meir! They are an example of dreaming big working hard and staying determined. I'm proud of their efforts and the history they've made.  https://t.co/jjZMsemMeb

Staff are hosting mobile office hours throughout the district in October. Click the link below for times and locations. If you need assistance with a federal agency or just want to meet our staff we encourage you to stop by!  https://t.co/XgWl9UGeud
Today is National POW MIA Recognition Day. We must remember and honor those captured or still missing. Please pause and reflect on the sacrifices made by our heroes. https://t.co/SuAxyN1bmJ

This Saturday our office will be conducting veteran interviews in partnership with the Library of Congress Veterans History Project. If you know of a veteran who wants to share their story please let our office know. Time slots are still available. 317-563-5567. https://t.co/DFEpXcrfLP
I'm proud to help support @LifeAtPurdue  and @USAID as they work toward new discoveries and innovation in food safety for our world.  https://t.co/JmOJfRzAVl

Great morning kicking off the 2019 Indiana State Fair at the @IndianaPork Ham Breakfast with my friends @GovHolcomb and @SenToddYoung! The breakfast highlights our producers and lets us celebrate their positive impact on The Hoosier State. https://t.co/Ec9r89N9CB

Agricultural exports in Indiana support over 38600 Hoosier jobs with an annual value totaling $4.6 billion and will only be enriched by USMCA. It’s a win for Hoosiers and our nation. It’s time to vote. Read my op-ed in @jconline: https://t.co/y2I4ZAB6WH. https://t.co/FwMGMkDMq9

.@US_Stratcom works tirelessly to protect our nation and our allies. I was honored to be a part of the 2019 #DeterrenceSymposium with my friend @RepDonBacon discussing the future of our capabilities and leadership on the global stage. https://t.co/C5LvTE3UHu

Farmers are some of the most innovative people in our country and their livelihoods sustain the world. Let’s thank them today and every day for their dedication to feeding our families and moving America forward. Read @SecretarySonny's op-ed below: https://t.co/VCb1AGBsSZ

Great to meet Jeff and Ryan Fleece from Hendricks County. They are with the Crop Insurance Professionals Association and visited my office to discuss our local #IN04 farmers. Thanks for stopping by! https://t.co/VetnPMFEpD
Members of my staff will be hosting mobile office hours this Wednesday July 31st at the Attica Public Library from 1-4pm (ET). Stop by and say hello!  305 S. Perry St. Attica IN 47918

Dan Coats served Hoosiers & our nation with integrity & principle throughout his career as a devoted public servant. He served our country exceptionally well as Director of National Intelligence and we thank him for his leadership on so many complex issues impacting our nation.

Calling all middle and high school students: the Congressional App Challenge is now open! Apps are due no later than November 1st – please click below for more info. Looking forward to seeing the creativity of our students in #IN04. https://t.co/CGhczOxlUr
Great to have fellow Hoosier and @LifeAtPurdue graduate Paige Rudin visit our office today! It’s always encouraging to see our future leaders visiting the nation’s capital. https://t.co/fXzskX5VZm

50 years ago millions of men women and children were inspired watching extraordinary events unfold as humanity took our first steps on the Moon and achieved the impossible. It was an honor to celebrate this historic achievement that has such a special Hoosier connection. https://t.co/gzoZWwhGcE

The opioid crisis has tragically destroyed the lives of many Hoosiers – it is vital that we use evidence-based policy to ensure the well-being of future generations. I’m very proud to see my bill with @RepWexton to combat this epidemic pass the House. https://t.co/d7gRvuM1dI
Great to meet with fellow Hoosiers from @IBAtweet! Thank you for the work you do in our communities especially in #IN04. https://t.co/Zf5x73V6gt

Very proud to have my first bill pass the House of Representatives! Hoosiers know that to grow as a nation we need everyone involved and investing in children early ensures that we are laying the groundwork to develop young innovators in STEM. https://t.co/upRQ4DUtgP

On Wednesday July 31 at 6pm representatives from the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) will hold a conference at the Brownsburg Library to meet with members of our #IN04 community and answer any questions you may have. We look forward to seeing you there! https://t.co/A2eC6Lmta1

Reminder: our office will be hosting mobile office hours in Crawfordsville today from 12-4pm ET. We'll be in Fowler tomorrow and West Lafayette on Wednesday. Stop by and say hello! https://t.co/pQpT8FsvOt

Grateful for the opportunity to promote literacy in our #IN04 communities. This week we visited libraries in Benton County and Warren County to donate surplus books from the Library of Congress. https://t.co/HEFMXJHlHl
Spent time this morning at Crossroads Diner and made a quick stop by Wolf’s Chocolate in Attica owned by State Rep. Sharon Negele. Great day in #IN04! https://t.co/ClIDZz7NiA

Great to join my House Science Committee colleagues for a discussion on the challenges rural areas face in providing quality STEM education. Teaching STEM concepts is vital for raising up future leaders & I will continue to advocate for these programs in our Hoosier communities. https://t.co/wN8owIizCY

I’m proud to work with @RepHaleyStevens @RepTimBurchett & @RepJasonCrow on legislation that will improve programs vital to our small businesses. We must take every opportunity to strengthen investment in R&D so we can continue moving our economy forward. https://t.co/SeVOwu6jog

Our staff will be holding mobile office hours today in Lebanon Delphi and West Lafayette. We’ll also be in Greencastle tomorrow and Rensselaer on Friday. Stop by and say hello! https://t.co/dFqtU32RDK

USMCA strengthens our partnerships and improves trade across North America so we can remain competitive and lead the world. It’s a win for Hoosiers and for our nation – the time to vote is now. Read my op-ed below: https://t.co/Y3jRrMNmpL

Until now NDAA has been bipartisan for over 50 years with both sides of the aisle coming together to support our military. I’m proud to stand with my @HouseGOP colleagues calling on House Democrats to put our troops and security first. https://t.co/MVynyxXDEB
It’s time to bring USMCA up for a vote — we must act now to kick start a new era of stronger modernized trade. Read my op-ed in @jconline below: https://t.co/Y3jRrMNmpL

Black vulture attacks on newborn calves can have a significant impact on profitability for our Hoosier cow calf producers. I’m proud to co-sponsor the Livestock Protection Act to give farmers and ranchers the freedom they need to protect their livestock. https://t.co/maYgddPmcM

Applications for fall 2019 semester internships in both our Washington D.C. office and Danville office are due no later than this Friday July 12! Click below to learn more and apply: https://t.co/rG29UJIpKE

We’ve now seen a record 105 straight months of job growth with unemployment remaining at its lowest level in 50 years. June’s #JobsReport shows 224000 jobs added nationwide as our economy continues to exceed expectations — this is great news for Hoosiers. https://t.co/joxgcNmUiN
Wishing Hoosiers a safe and happy Independence Day! https://t.co/UchiRGdDYy

Enjoyed visiting the Family Health Clinic in Delphi for the unveiling of their newly renovated clinic space. Preventative care rural access to healthcare and prenatal care are vitally important to our nation and district and we thank you for the work you do in our community. https://t.co/PyqyzBB5R9
Very grateful for the opportunity to partner with the Library of Congress to donate books and visit the Boys and Girls Club of Clinton County in Frankfort. https://t.co/riaZ7Fb2Qr
Great morning with Hendricks Power Employees in Avon! They’re part of the nation’s largest energy network helping to serve over 30000 Hoosiers in #IN04. https://t.co/N9SmCCzwMQ

It’s a privilege to honor Dorothy Brown in Congress for her dedication to Greencastle and to thousands of students at DePauw University. Our community is better because of her selflessness and I’m proud to call her a fellow Hoosier. https://t.co/wR1j6DSkWy

Great turnout in Lafayette at our second Veterans History Project training workshop! Thank you to all who joined us this evening. Looking forward to hearing the stories of our 4th District Hoosier veterans. https://t.co/dxKnDfVCLF

Thank you to @SecretaryPerry for emphasizing the return on investment that R&D programs provide to keep us at the forefront of scientific innovation. As a Hoosier farmer & scientist it's vitally important to emphasize the necessity of these programs in our bioproducts industry. https://t.co/y8tufSlRIZ

Great to have @SecretaryPerry with us in @housesciencegop this morning taking a look at DOE’s priorities and the role R&D can play in diversifying our biofuel and bioproducts industry. Tune in: https://t.co/xnA0pZkzmO. https://t.co/8NxKtiKPfl

It’s an honor to welcome #IN04 2019 Congressional Art Competition winner Catherine Caes to our nation’s capital. Her creativity demonstrates what this competition is all about and I am proud to showcase her work over the next year in Washington. https://t.co/Y9o8ZxHtT5
I’m honored to recognize Dorothy “Mom” Brown in Congress for her selfless dedication to our community and her 26 years of service to the Phi Kappa Psi house. https://t.co/v9veGYsqzS

The opioid epidemic does not discriminate and has tragically destroyed the lives of many Hoosiers – this devastating crisis must come to an end. I’m proud that my bill with @RepWexton to research addiction will be brought before the House for a vote. https://t.co/y2odVmfcGj
Congratulations to the new @IndianaFFA State Officer Team! https://t.co/Jcij98TOFZ

Our office is now accepting internship applications for the fall 2019 semester. Internships are open to qualified undergraduate and graduate students with ties to #IN04 and are due no later than July 12th. Click below to learn more: https://t.co/aoPRk2GOM6

The opioid crisis has devastated communities across the nation. I’m proud to see my bipartisan bill with @RepWexton pass through @housesciencegop and I look forward to supporting the EFFORT Act as it goes before the House for a vote. https://t.co/2nrS0Qxfid

By responsibly increasing funding for USDA’s DLT grant program we can provide educational opportunities & improved healthcare without additional cost to taxpayers. I’m proud to support @RepGregPence's amendment ensuring all Hoosier communities have access to adequate broadband. https://t.co/1o26Xeq0MB
.@INFarmBureau works daily to serve Hoosier farmers and producers. Enjoyed meeting with them this week to discuss #IN04 agriculture and broadband issues. https://t.co/vZLnTUa4pP

Morgan Molly and Tommy have been a great help serving #IN04 in my Washington D.C. office over the past couple of months. Thank you for all of your work on behalf of 4th District Hoosiers! https://t.co/mR95ULHy0r

Enjoyed speaking this afternoon with the @IndianaEC Youth Tour including 39 exceptional students representing #IN04. @YouthTourDC is vital in elevating success in our future leaders. https://t.co/FnCUw1sTXI

Our office will be holding mobile office hours today from 11am-2pm ET at the Logansport-Cass County Public Library and in other locations throughout the month of June. Stop by and say hello! https://t.co/aCJAP2MBIR
Trey and Jared are fantastic interns currently serving in our Danville office. Thank you for all of your hard work on behalf of the 4th District. https://t.co/BxjoV2BUpW
Today we celebrate the freedom and liberty that our flag symbolizes. Happy #FlagDay! https://t.co/2YtYVNbnHb

.@SusanWBrooks has been a champion of Hoosier values and will be greatly missed in the U.S. House of Representatives. It has been a pleasure to serve with her and I wish her the very best. https://t.co/flKQfcnAeQ
Happy 244th birthday to the @USArmy! https://t.co/YfKBnQ97QL
Great to speak with @AllAgAllDay about our Hoosier farmers and the crucial role agriculture plays in our economy. https://t.co/C5e4jASRDo
Our staff will be holding mobile office hours today at the West Lafayette Public Library from 12-4pm ET. Stop by and say hello!  208 W. Columbia St. West Lafayette IN 47906

With 56800 operational farms The Hoosier State is one of the top agriculture producing states in the country. Read my op-ed with @SenatorBraun on why Indiana is the best choice for @USDA as they look to move ERS & NIFA closer to the farmers they serve. https://t.co/QKkwbSwhMu

The opioid crisis does not discriminate and has tragically destroyed lives in our Hoosier communities. I’m proud to introduce the EFFORT Act with my colleague @RepWexton to help prevent addiction before it begins. https://t.co/lRTuL1cyzq
Today we remember the heroism and sacrifice of the soldiers who landed in the unknown and fought to protect freedom. #DDay75years https://t.co/kdYqkWbzuI

Indiana is the best choice for @USDA as they look to move ERS and NIFA closer to our farmers and growers. Read my op-ed with @SenatorBraun below as we write why they should call The Hoosier State home. https://t.co/QKkwbSwhMu
It's an honor to continue serving my country in Congress with @RepDanCrenshaw and @RepBrianMast. Check out our interview with @foxandfriends this morning in New York City. https://t.co/KdGSAgjc9P

I’ll be joining my friends @RepDanCrenshaw and @RepBrianMast tomorrow at 6:20am ET/5:20am CT on @foxandfriends talking about the privilege we have to continue serving our country as veterans in Congress. Be sure to tune in!
It was great to tour @EvonikN_America in Lafayette this week. Thank you for investing in our community and for your continued state of the art research to improve lives. https://t.co/sGiaRalrZE
Thank you to the Greencastle Rotary Club for the invitation to join you this week! Always enjoy these discussions about the great things happening in our community. https://t.co/x2HFYm7riN
Enjoyed touring Amazon’s impressive fulfillment facility in Plainfield and meeting many hardworking members of our #IN04 community. https://t.co/RY265lCVsl

Honored to recognize my alma mater on @LifeAtPurdue's 150th Anniversary! It was a privilege to present this congressional record to @purduemitch celebrating a century and a half of excellence. #BoilerUp https://t.co/D1cxGIvfwK
Thank you to @HomeDepotGR for an excellent tour in Lafayette! Their investment in families and small businesses plays an integral role in our #IN04 community. https://t.co/vglFVXtjF6

The Tippecanoe County Veterans Treatment Court utilizes unique aspects of military culture to provide hope and healing through mentorships treatment and supervision. Thanks for letting us join you today. https://t.co/kyAce6fsEV
Today we remember all of those who have paid the ultimate sacrifice in defense of our nation and the rights that we hold dear. We are free because of their bravery. https://t.co/ttFU1620WE

Fascinating to learn how @NOAA's Gulfstream IV-SP "hurricane hunter" and the Beechcraft King Air 350 assist in emergency responses. These unique aircrafts save lives and help us better prepare for natural disasters. https://t.co/MhvzR3OBoS

I’m pleased to see that President Trump and Secretary Perdue are taking action to provide relief for our farmers and ranchers. Looking forward to working with my colleagues to find a long term solution for Hoosiers. https://t.co/KshF86BglT

The SECURE Act enables everyone to save better for their future – I’m proud to support bipartisan legislation that makes it easier for our Hoosier families to keep more of their money. https://t.co/7Zsla1nL5j
Enjoyed seeing some cutting-edge inventions and breakthrough technology on the Hill this week. Thanks to Intellectual Ventures for stopping by! https://t.co/7O9wIkcJ7Q

Great to visit with reigning Indy 500 champion Will Power! We’re just a few days away from The Greatest Spectacle in Racing! Looking forward to an exciting and safe 103rd running of the Indy 500. https://t.co/IcwlqtD531

100 years ago the House of Representatives passed the 19th Amendment which would guarantee women the right to vote. Today we honor the courage and bravery of the all those who fought to give women a voice in our democracy. #WomensVote100 https://t.co/ze8Pg3W3H2

The courage and stories of our veterans deserve to be remembered forever. If you are a veteran or are interested in interviewing a veteran we encourage you to take part in this invaluable project. https://t.co/KW5NzlHt3e

Great to see students from @IvyTechCC this week in Washington. I’m always encouraged when young people visit our nation’s capital to engage in politics firsthand and witness our democratic process. https://t.co/mLOGMxyCwm

Happy Mother’s Day! Thank you to mothers everywhere for your selflessness and for the sacrifices you make every day. https://t.co/fACCFMRwod

Congratulations to Catherine Caes the winner of this year’s #IN04 Congressional Art Competition! I’m proud to showcase her work in the halls of our nation’s capital. https://t.co/cHkB0e6nzv

It was a pleasure to meet @Astro_Feustel today. We had a great discussion about the path to Mars the depth of his training and time aboard the International Space Station and how we can all work together to pave the way for future generations. Thank you for your work Drew. https://t.co/1eILbiXEB1

Our economy continues to soar above expectations – we’re now at the lowest unemployment rate in 50 years with 263000 jobs added in April. This is very welcome news for 4th District Hoosiers! I’m proud to work with my colleagues as we continue this momentum. #JobsReport https://t.co/xSWE2uOADe
